tool.name: Mauve Alignment Graph
tool.help:
**What it does**
Create a graph from an XMFA alignment backbone. This is only interesting in an academic fashion, to see exactly how the alignment proceeded.
**Example Output**
The normal output is a PDF file, but a snippet of the graph has been rendered below as ASCII Art. Blocks represent a set of sequence which is shared amongst one or more genomes. The lines represent the paths individual genomes take. The first block contains just genomes 2 and 3, as does the second block. The third block also references genomes 0, and 1::
+----------------------------------------------------------+ +--| Alignment Start | | +----------------------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | 2 | 3 | | v | | | +-------------------------------------------+ | | | | Seq 2: 135417-135419 Seq 3: 135192-135194 | <+ | | +-------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | 2, 3 | | v | | +-------------------------------------------+ | | | Seq 2: 124592-124595 Seq 3: 124367-124370 | -+ | | +-------------------------------------------+ | | | | | | | | 2 | 3 | 0, 1 | v v v | +----------------------------------------------------------+ | | Seq 0: 3-14 Seq 1: 142-153 Seq 2: 158-169 Seq 3: 122-133 | | +----------------------------------------------------------+
